alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:25AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Douglas and south central Jefferson Counties through 1115 AM MDT... At 1024 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Devil`s Head, or 34 miles south of Denver, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail, brief moderate to heavy rainfall, up to one half inch possible in 30 minutes. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Castle Rock, Larkspur, Westcreek, Perry Park, Devil`s Head, Sprucewood, Cheesman Reservoir, Deckers, Franktown and Greenland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
